This is just a WAG, but if you unplug the network cable (or turn off your Wifi if applicable), does it run any faster?  In my experience, if something takes a long time but still works, I automatically think "timeout on worthless network activity".  I don't know why Ant would be talking to the network (DTD/schema validation?) but it's something to check for...

You can also try a thread dump (ctrl-break on Windows, ctrl-\ on Linux) to get an idea of what's happening during that time, if Ant is actively running the test or (more likely) stuck somewhere.

Scott

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: mobile_fhx 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Tuesday, July 06, 2004 6:10 AM
  Subject: [junit] JUnit / ANT timeout


  Hello JUnit group,

  Ive run into a problem when testing a testcase from ANT. When i am
  running the test from command line, everything is fast and the test is
  done under 1 sec. But when testing the exact same testcase from ANT
  its taking about 5 minuttes to perform the test. 

  My testcase makes use of the JUnit addons extension for testing
  arrays, but i dont think that is the problem.

  My test uses a lot of for-loops and arrays like the one shown below:
  for (int i = 0; i < 0x7F; i++) {
        final int[] input = { 
              ((i & 0x7F)           | ((i & 0x7F) << 7)) & 0xFF, 
              (((i & 0x7F) >>> 1) | ((i & 0x7F) << 6)) & 0xFF,
              (((i & 0x7F) >>> 2) | ((i & 0x7F) << 5)) & 0xFF,
              (((i & 0x7F) >>> 3) & 0xFF),
        };
        final int[] actual = GsmToolbox.unpack7Bit(input, 7);
        final int[] expected = fillValues(i, 4);
        ArrayAssert.assertEquals("Value was: " + i, expected, actual);
  }

  Does anyone have an idea of what is wrong ??? - why does it take so
  long time when testing from ANT ???

  /Frank Henningsen
